creator: Emmet
title: Running a Public Static Website from a Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this tutorial, you will learn how you can set up a publicly accessible website on your Raspberry Pi using a Cloudflare tunnel and the Nginx web server.

The post Running a Public Static Website from a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:
In this tutorial, you will learn how you can set up a publicly accessible website on your Raspberry Pi using a Cloudflare tunnel and the Nginx web server.

creator: Emmet
title: How to Install Windows on a Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this project, we will be showing you how to install and run the Windows operating system on a Raspberry Pi. While it is possible to run Windows, it can be a bit of a rough experience due to the lack of proper driver support for the PI's many built-in hardware.

The post How to Install Windows on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:
In this project, we will be showing you how to install and run the Windows operating system on a Raspberry Pi.  While it is possible to run Windows, it can be a bit of a rough experience due to the lack of proper driver support for the PI's many built-in hardware.
The post How to Install Windows on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Running Deepseek on a Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this project, we will be showing you how you can run the Deepseek AI models on a Raspberry Pi by using their distilled variants. A distilled model is essentially a cut down version of the full Deepseek AI model. It isn't as capable but allows it to run on weaker devices.

The post Running Deepseek on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:
In this project, we will be showing you how you can run the Deepseek AI models on a Raspberry Pi by using their distilled variants. A distilled model is essentially a cut down version of the full Deepseek AI model. It isn't as capable but allows it to run on weaker devices.
The post Running Deepseek on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Top 3D Printed Cases for the Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this article, we will be exploring some of the best 3D printed cases that you can print yourself for your Raspberry Pi. 3D printing a case can give you some unique designs and can also be super cost effective.

The post Top 3D Printed Cases for the Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Programming an Arduino from a Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this guide, we will walk you through the steps of install and using the Arduino IDE on a Raspberry Pi. This software allows you to program an Arduino directly from your Pi.

The post Programming an Arduino from a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Manage your Filament with Spoolman on the Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this project, we will show you how to install Spoolman on to your Raspberry Pi. This software enables you to track your filament usage through an easy-to-use web interface. It can even integrate with your printer to automatically update your filament usage.

The post Manage your Filament with Spoolman on the Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:
In this project, we will show you how to install Spoolman on to your Raspberry Pi. This software enables you to track your filament usage through an easy-to-use web interface. It can even integrate with your printer to automatically update your filament usage.

creator: Emmet
title: Hosting your Audiobook and Podcast Library on a Raspberry Pi
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this tutorial, you will learn how you can easily host your audiobook and podcast libraries on a Raspberry Pi using Audiobookshelf. This software scans your media and serves it through a web or native app on your phone. If you have used Plex before, you will know how Audiobookshelf works.

The post Hosting your Audiobook and Podcast Library on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:

The post Hosting your Audiobook and Podcast Library on a Raspberry Pi appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Easily Monitor your Docker Logs with Dozzle
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this guide, we will show you how to easily monitor your Docker logs in real-time through your web browser using Dozzle. This software is a lightweight web app that makes viewing and searching your logs a simple process.

The post Easily Monitor your Docker Logs with Dozzle appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: Setting up Node-RED using Docker
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this quick guide, you will learn how to set up Node-RED using a Docker container easily. This software makes setting up automation incredibly easy thanks to its drag-and-drop web interface and flow-based workflow.

The post Setting up Node-RED using Docker appeared first on Pi My Life Up.

creator: Emmet
title: How to Install Jellyfin on Ubuntu
dc:creator: Emmet
content:
In this quick guide, we will show you how to install the Jellyfin media server onto the Ubuntu operating system. Jellyfin is one of the best alternatives to Plex and is known for being free and open-source. It has many of the features of Plex and excellent client support.

The post How to Install Jellyfin on Ubuntu appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
contentSnippet:
In this quick guide, we will show you how to install the Jellyfin media server onto the Ubuntu operating system. Jellyfin is one of the best alternatives to Plex and is known for being free and open-source. It has many of the features of Plex and excellent client support.
The post How to Install Jellyfin on Ubuntu appeared first on Pi My Life Up.
